It's raining, and you're getting drenched. You don't have an umbrella, and there is nowhere to hide from the rain. Suddenly one of the local cult members rushes to you with an umbrella handle.
"Here, here's an umbrella! Use it! By the way, have you heard of our Lord and Savior...?"

kanji.mnemonic:
What do you do when your child just won't behave and absolutely refuses to study? You lock him up in a derelict hut deep in the forest, and force him to study under a roof full of tiny hairs which are — on a closer look — millions of tiny, hairy, disgusting caterpillars.
And since the hut's roof is so old and dilapidated it can collapse at any time. The threat of all of those creepy caterpillars falling on your child's head should really motivate him to study. The faster he studies the faster he'll be able to leave the hut!

kanji.mnemonic:
What do you do when your child just won't behave and absolutely refuses to study? You lock him up in a derelict hut deep in the forest, and force him to study under a roof full of tiny hairs which are — on a closer look — millions of tiny, hairy, disgusting caterpillars.
And since the hut's roof is so old and dilapidated it can collapse at any time. The threat of all of those creepy caterpillars falling on your child's head should really motivate him to study. The faster he studies the faster he'll be able to leave the hut!

kanji.mnemonic:
What do you do when your child just won't behave and absolutely refuses to study? You lock him up in a derelict hut deep in the forest, and force him to study under a roof full of tiny hairs which are — on a closer look — millions of tiny, hairy, disgusting caterpillars.
And since the hut's roof is so old and dilapidated it can collapse at any time. The threat of all of those creepy caterpillars falling on your child's head should really motivate him to study. The faster he studies the faster he'll be able to leave the hut!

kanji.mnemonic:
What do you do when your child just won't behave and absolutely refuses to study? You lock him up in a derelict hut deep in the forest, and force him to study under a roof full of tiny hairs which are — on a closer look — millions of tiny, hairy, disgusting caterpillars.
And since the hut's roof is so old and dilapidated it can collapse at any time. The threat of all of those creepy caterpillars falling on your child's head should really motivate him to study. The faster he studies the faster he'll be able to leave the hut!

It's raining, and you're getting drenched. You don't have an umbrella, and there is nowhere to hide from the rain. Suddenly one of the local cult members rushes to you with an umbrella handle.
"Here, here's an umbrella! Use it! By the way, have you heard of our Lord and Savior...?"
Sneaky! Cult members are usually very polite when they try to convert you to their religion. Then they bring you to their temple, get you to kneel before their altar, and the next thing you know you're one of them, looking for the next victim.
